item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，美国标普500指数2025年收红
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 加拿大牧场主因担心特朗普征收关税而缩减牛群，牛肉价格可能上涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普当选后，加拿大农民乔恩-瓦格斯（Jon Vaags）于 11 月放弃购买肉牛，因为对加拿大出口产品征收关税似乎是一个严重的风险。【原文：Canadian farmer Jon Vaags quit buying beef cattle in November after the election of U.S. President Donald Trump made tariffs on Canadian exports seem like a serious risk.】

item.title: 联想在英国与爱立信关于临时专利许可的上诉中胜诉
item.description: 联想集团周五在英国的上诉中胜诉，试图获得使用爱立信专利的临时许可证，这是两家公司就5G无线技术的全球许可纠纷做出的最新裁决。【原文：Lenovo on Friday won an appeal in Britain in its attempt to get an interim licence to use Ericsson's patents, in the latest ruling in the companies' global licensing dispute over 5G wireless technology.】

item.title: 焦点转向关键通胀数据，期指稳步上扬
item.description: 美国股指期货周五小幅上扬，在本周早些时候大幅下跌后企稳，原因是投资者将注意力转移到一个可能影响美联储货币政策预期的关键通胀数据上。【原文：U.S. stock index futures inched up on Friday, steadying after sharp declines earlier this week, as investors shifted their focus to a key inflation figure that could influence expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's monetary policy trajectory.】

item.title: 耐克陷入困境，阿迪达斯瞄准更大的美国市场份额
item.description: 投资者和分析师表示，阿迪达斯能否从市场领导者耐克手中赢得更多美国购物者的青睐，将是其今年能否继续取得成功的关键，因为这个德国品牌正在桑巴（Samba）和瞪羚（Gazelle）运动鞋之外寻找新的增长点。【原文：Whether Adidas can win more American shoppers from market leader Nike will be key to its continued success this year, investors and analysts said, as the German brand looks for new sources of growth beyond its Samba and Gazelle sneakers.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 投资者对经济的担忧加剧，美国就业数据将是考验
item.description: 下周的美国月度就业报告事关重大，因为投资者要判断一连串令人担忧的数据是否预示着对经济的重大担忧。【原文：The stakes are high for the monthly U.S. jobs report in the coming week, as investors gauge whether a string of worrisome data is signaling significant concern about the economy.】

item.title: 洞察力：特朗普瞄准电动汽车补贴，通用汽车的电动汽车收益面临严峻考验
item.description: 几十年来，通用汽车斥资数十亿美元试图开辟一条电动汽车发展之路，推出了许多电动汽车和混合动力汽车的先驱，但最终都未能在市场上实现大规模销售，最终被废弃。这一次可能会有所不同。【原文：General Motors has spent billions over decades trying to blaze an electric trail, releasing pioneering EVs and hybrids that ultimately failed to achieve mass-market sales before being scrapped. This time might be different.】

item.title: 全球股票基金因关税问题吸引大量资金流入
item.description: 截至 2 月 26 日的一周内，受今年晚些时候降息预期持续升温的刺激，全球股票基金资金大幅流入，而本周报告的疲软经济数据又为这一预期提供了支撑。【原文：Global equity funds witnessed sharp inflows in the week through February 26, spurred by sustained expectations of rate cuts later this year, which were bolstered by weaker economic data reported during the week.】

item.title: 中国规定自动驾驶软件升级须经监管部门批准
item.description: 中国工业部周五表示，与自动驾驶相关的空中软件升级必须获得监管部门的批准，这是旨在防止汽车制造商利用软件升级隐瞒缺陷或逃避责任的新规定的一部分。【原文：Autonomous driving-related over-the-air software upgrades will be subject to regulatory approvals, China's industry ministry said on Friday, part of new regulations aimed at preventing automakers using them to conceal defects or avoid liability.】

item.title: 新华社：中国空间站将在未来几年迎来首位外国宇航员
item.description: 据新华社报道，中国和巴基斯坦周五签署了关于航天员选拔和培训的合作协议。【原文：China and Pakistan signed a cooperation agreement on the selection and training of astronauts on Friday, Xinhua reported.】

item.title: 通胀疲软、增长乏力支持欧洲央行降息
item.description: 周五的最新数据显示，欧元区的通胀前景有所改善，但经济增长依然乏力，这为欧洲央行进一步降息以刺激已停滞近两年的经济提供了更充分的理由。【原文：Euro zone inflation prospects improved while growth remained anaemic, fresh data showed on Friday, solidifying the case for further ECB rate cuts to stimulate an economy that has been stagnant for nearly two years.】

item.title: Two dozen arrested for distributing AI-generated child abuse images
item.description: Two dozen people were arrested this week for their role in a criminal group that distributed images generated by artificial intelligence of children being sexually abused, Europol said on Friday.

item.title: New World Development reports $852 million first-half net loss
item.description: New World Development , one of the biggest property developers in Hong Kong, reported an interim net loss of HK$6.63 billion ($852.45 million) on Friday, following a prolonged property downturn and high interest costs.

item.title: UK chip parts supplier Morgan Advanced flags revenue hit as trade tariff woes hit demand
item.description: Semiconductor parts supplier Morgan Advanced Materials on Friday forecast a drop in organic revenue this year due to uncertain demand, sparked, in part, by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff threats.

item.title: Euro zone consumers lower near-term inflation expectations, ECB survey shows
item.description: Euro zone consumers lowered their near-term inflation expectations last month but continued to see economic contraction ahead, indicating that households remain relatively downbeat on the bloc's prospects, an ECB survey showed on Friday.

item.title: Chinese mainland investors drive surge in Hong Kong stocks
item.description: China's mainland investors have played an unprecedented role in a rally on Hong Kong's equity market that has pushed the benchmark index to its highest level since 2022.

item.title: Citi raises first-quarter average tin price forecast, sees easing in second quarter
item.description: Citi Research raised its average tin price forecast for the first quarter of 2025 to $32,000 per metric ton from $29,000 on Friday but noted that prices will start easing from the second quarter.

item.title: Citigroup mistakenly credits customer account with $81 trillion in "near miss", FT reports
item.description: Citigroup erroneously credited $81 trillion, instead of $280, to a customer's account and took hours to reverse the transaction, a "near miss" that shows up the bank's operational issues it has sought to fix, the Financial Times reported on Friday.

item.title: British Airways owner IAG profit beats estimates, plans share buyback
item.description: British Airways owner IAG reported a 27% jump in annual operating profit on Friday, beating market expectations as it curbed costs and growth in its lucrative transatlantic routes took off.

item.title: 新加坡指控三人诈骗，媒体称与英伟达芯片有关
item.description: Singapore charged three men with fraud in a case domestic media have linked to the movement of Nvidia's advanced chips from the city state to Chinese artificial intelligence firm DeepSeek.

item.title: Car parts supplier Forvia forecasts 2025 sales at around last year level
item.description: French car parts supplier Forvia said on Friday it sees sales in 2025 at around last year's level, reflecting a downturn in European and North American automotive demand dragging into the new year.

item.title: Exclusive: Chinese banks heed PBOC call to cut dollar deposit rates, say sources
item.description: China's banks are cutting the interest rates offered on U.S. dollar deposits after being asked to do so by the central bank, possibly to curtail dollar hoarding and also prop up a weakening yuan, sources said.

item.title: Bytedance's TikTok to invest $8.8 bln in Thailand data centres, official says
item.description: ByteDance's TikTok will invest $8.8 billion in data centres in Thailand over five years, Helena Lersch, TikTok's Vice President of Public Policy, said on Friday at an event in Bangkok.

item.title: Russia's seizures offer warning to Western firms hoping for Trump-inspired return
item.description: One morning in October 2024, three men entered the Moscow headquarters of Glavprodukt, the largest maker of canned food in Russia. One announced himself as the new director general and said he would now be making the decisions.

item.title: Crypto prices tumble as Trump-fuelled euphoria fades
item.description: Cryptocurrency prices are down sharply in recent weeks and not expected to rebound soon, with some of the biggest digital currencies erasing nearly all of the gains they made after Donald Trump's election win triggered a wave of excitement across the industry.

item.title: 水泥生产商 Holcim 第四季度盈利超出预期
item.description: Holcim 公司周五公布的第四季度财报好于预期，该建材公司公布了分拆北美业务计划的更多细节。【原文：Holcim reported better-than-expected earnings for its fourth quarter on Friday as the building materials company gave more details of its plan to spin off its North American business.】

item.title: 早间竞标特朗普关税忧虑无处藏身
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 中国表示反对美国最新关税威胁
item.description: 中国周五表示，反对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普因致命毒品流入美国而对中国进口商品额外征收10%关税的最新威胁，指责白宫 "推卸责任 "并采取措施破坏全球供应链的稳定。【原文：China on Friday said it opposed President Donald Trump's latest threat to slap an extra 10% duty on Chinese imports over deadly drug flows into the U.S., accusing the White House of "shifting the blame" and taking steps to destabilise global supply chains.】

item.title: 独家报道：英国能源大臣将于三月访华，重启能源谈判并会见投资者
item.description: 三位直接了解该计划的消息人士告诉路透社，英国能源大臣埃德-米利班德（Ed Miliband）将于 3 月访华，重启能源合作谈判并会见中国投资者。【原文：British Energy Secretary Ed Miliband will visit China in March to restart talks on energy cooperation and meet Chinese investors, three sources with direct knowledge of the plan told Reuters, as the Labour government seeks closer China ties amid worsening U.S.- and EU-China relations.】

item.title: 受中国钢铁出口担忧影响，铁矿石将出现月度亏损
item.description: 受美国关税担忧和针对中国钢铁出口的贸易摩擦加剧的打压，铁矿石期货价格周五下跌，并将出现小幅月度跌幅。【原文：Iron ore futures prices fell on Friday and were set for modest monthly losses, pressured by U.S. tariff concerns and mounting trade frictions against Chinese steel exports.】
